newsitem.title: USA: Safety 1st restates Q3 due to re-pricing.
newsitem.headline: Safety 1st restates Q3 due to re-pricing.

text.p: Safety 1st Inc said Wednesday it had restated its financial results for the 1996 third quarter to a net loss of $0.2 million, or $0.03 per share.
Originally it reported net income of $0.6 million, or $0.08 per share.
The company said the figures were restated as a result of the repricing of certain non-employee stock options during the quarter.
The company said that during the 1996 second quarter it began a review of its product mix and took the first steps to refocus its business on its traditional, core product lines.
It said that in the fourth quarter it took additional steps to "dramatically reduce the number of its product offerings by eliminating 350 juvenile and hardware products."

It said it had reduced planned sales of products introduced this year to about $20 million, concentrating on those products in the areas of its core development expertise. Sales of new products totaled $34 million in 1995 and $33 million in 1996, it said.
As a result of these and other measures, Safety 1st said it expects to reduce its base level of operating expenses to about 30 percent of revenues in 1997.
Safety 1st reported a net loss of $38.1 million, or $5.33 per share, for the fourth quarter of 1996.

The company said it recorded a $32.7 million pretax charge in the fourth quarter associated with a redefining of its business strategy, particularly the previously announced realignment of the Safety 1st product mix, including a $10.2 million charge in connection with SFAS 121.
Excluding the pretax charges, the company would have recorded a fourth quarter pretax loss of $10.1 million, it said.
